reviews.text: My wife and I ust got back yesterday from a 5 night stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. Our time there was wonderful! The rooms are huge -- especially the beautiful bathrooms which have a double sink, seperate lavatory room, a soaking tub and an enormous shower. We were in the 500 section which is approximately in the middle of the resort near the main pool area. I've read some of the other reviews about waiting 30 minutes for a golf cart (why would you do that when it doesn't take more than 15 minutes to walk anywhere) to pick you up and have to say we did not experience that. The carts ran constantly We actually walked most of the time both to the beach and to the lobby/convention center area. The resort also has mountain bikes available at all tram stops which can be used for free to get around and a boat system. The staff are very polite and eager to be of service. The grounds are beautiful. We loved the infinity edge pool by the ocean. The gym at the spa has high end workout equipment and was usually almost empty when I went. Only downsides were about half of the people in our party came down with the stomach flu although I'm sure it happened off the resort. The food was just OK. The breakfast buffet's could have been better. Drinks were very high priced. The beach was also really windy - think sandblasting. I have never been to Cancun before so I'm not sure if that's common or not. Despite a few minor shortcomings I would strongly recommend this resort!
reviews.title: First Class Operation! Loved it!

reviews.text: i stayed at the Mayakoba for 3 nights attending a conference, May 6th -9th the trek to my casita was over 2 bridges down a path past the golf course and meandering thru the mangrove jungle and then arrived at my casita, my casita was a one bedroom beachfront one with its own plunge pool on the beach, too bad that i did not have the time to enjoy it as i had scheduled workshops and functions all day until late at night.the butler did show up and offered his services the room was beautiful, with its living room guest bath, huge bedroom, and awesome masterbath bath loved the glass enclosed shower feature that made you feel you were outside in the jungle with the vegetation only problem with being this far away from the main complex was that only means of transport was to walk at night was creepy as the iguanas crossed the path and scared the daylights out of me, of course your in the tropics so there are insects....was bitten at an outdoor fucntion by mosquitos daytime walk was too hot and sweaty by the time i got to the main building) ride a bike, same thing hot and sweaty dressed in business attire for a function or call and wait for the buggy golfcart to shuttle yuo back and forth , i soon learnt that one needs a 15 min window to get from the beach to the main building. one night friends came by to visit and enjoy the pool when we called for the cart it took 20 mins to show up...there was a slight smell of burning garbage in the morning as i guess with the on going construction next door on the beach they may have been burning garbage on that site, needless to say it was not pleasant to smell first thing in the am
reviews.title: huge property lacking service
$400 iPod STOLEN BY STAFF, pretty resort, poor service
reviews.text: sure wished thet had LED alram clocks as they have alram clocks were battery operated and did not glow in the dark,
the ac turned itself off in the middle of the night and i woke up in a sweat and had to turn it on again !
reviews.title: Nice resort but poor service

reviews.text: checkout was chaotic as the baggage cart was making its rounds collecting luggage and when it did arrive our bags were not on the cart after we were told they were, so another 10 mins for the baggage to arrive.
reviews.title: Very nice resort that just needs to hire a few more waitstaff

reviews.text: I just got back from a 5 nite stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba. I read all the reviews herein and was a tad nervous considering the amount of negative feedback, but it turned out to be completely unwarranted.
reviews.title: Don't Believe The Negative Reviews

reviews.text: Yes, it's the Fairmont -- so it is $17 USD for two litres of water and $55 for breakfast. It's expensive, no doubt. Rediculously expensive in fact, but not suprising. It ain't a Super 8.
reviews.title: They Lie - Go somewhere else

likes.disliked: — The overall exerience caused more grief than relaxation

reviews.text: Service = average. They do try.
reviews.title: High and lows...

reviews.text: Food = average. Certainly nothing breathtaking.
reviews.title: Beautiful facilities, but service is lacking!

reviews.text: Grounds = gorgeous. Yes, it's big, but not daunting. Golf cart service is quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Relaxing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for three nights during mid-May. This was the largest of three properties we stayed at during our vacation.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, I agree that this is a very large property but I tended to see the good in the size. You are easily able to hop on a bike, cart, or even a small boat to get around. We never had a problem accessing transportation. Let's face it, walking is not such a bad thing either.
reviews.title: Fabuloso!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (in one of the casitas) was very pretty, clean, minimal, with the highlight being the bathroom (gorgeous shower and large bathtub). The various pools were immaculate (another reason the large property is a bonus - many pools to select from). Yes, the restuarants were a bit overpriced, but what hotel restuarants are not?
reviews.title: Overpriced, poor service...Generally would not reccommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the spa and my husband enjoyed the golf course. The spa ammenities are terrific - know that there is a separate pool on the roof. I took a toning class in the gym and the trainer was very helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting and reasonable value for location

reviews.text: Unfortunately, I do agree on the service - it was certainly lacking to say the least. Not once did anyone offer to help us with towels at the pools and nor walk around and ask if you might be interested in lunch or a drink. It is pretty much a DIY hotel on that end. Also, the service in the restuarants (we went to all except the lobby restaurant) was the same - very slow and inattentive. We expected a better quality of service from a Fairmont property. I do think that once the surrounding resorts open (Mandarin Oriental, Viceroy, Rosewood), they will be forced to step up the service or they will lose clientele.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely property about a half an hour drive south of the Cancun airport and about 10 minutes north of Playa del Carmen. The sprawling property is situated adjacent to a golf club and along the ocean, though the bulk of the property is set back from the water. Check in was efficient, and as Fairmont President's Club members we were upgraded to a suite as well as offered complementary entrance to the spa and 2 for 1 rounds of golf. Walking around the property takes a while since it is so spread out. They do offer trolley service around the property as well as water shuttles to select places and one can use the hotel's bikes to get around, although the walkways are not super wide and can to treacherous to negotiate. The rooms are very new, modern, and clean. Our suite had a living room with patio overlooking the waterway and a distant ocean view, the bedroom had a king bed with additional seating, and there were two full bathrooms in our room. The spa is really spectacular with separate men's and women's sauna, outdoor whirlpool, and steam rooms. The lobby restaurant was pricey and good, but since the food in Playa is so good in general, we felt it was much better to eat in town. The beach is very large, though there were lots of rocks in the ocean so remember to bring your aquasocks. There are several pools--one at the beach and the main one in the middle of the property, which is really a series of smaller pools linked together. Plenty of chairs and towels at both locations. The restaurant at the ocean was perfect for a tasty lunch. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay--pricey but luxe!
reviews.title: Ola!

likes.disliked: — Very spread out, beach far away from the main resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Fairmont Mayakoba and had a wonderful experience. I should preface my review by stating that we got a very good deal through Expedia for the rooms so I didn't feel we were paying through the nose for a five star hotel. I may have judged it differently had we paid full price.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

reviews.text: To begin with, transportation from Cancun airport went very smoothly. We arrived at the hotel and checked in without any problems. We were assigned a staff member to assist us to our room and orient us around the hotel. Our room was in the main block nearest the lobby area (cheapest room rate). It was beautiful. As you enter the room there is a small foyer area, a full walk-in closest with a safe, king size bed, nice size balcony with a bench, two chairs and a table - - we had a beautiful view of the swimming pool, gardens, and lagoons. The bathroom is
reviews.title: FAIRmont Experience

reviews.text: phenomenal - - double sinks, soaking tub, frameless glass shower and a seperate toilet area. The air conditioning and fan were in perfect working order. There is a fridge for use in the credenza.
reviews.title: Underwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at every restaurant in the hotel. We had dinner the first night at El Puerto which is located in the main lobby. The service was wonderful and the food was good - - however, I didn't feel like there was a very diverse selection. Dinner ran us about $160 USD (no drinks). La Laguna grill, which is located in the middle of the resort, walking distance from our building, was where we had breakfast most mornings. Buffet is about $25 USD per person. If you order ala carte it is still around $15-20. Dinner was very good, had a little more flair in terms
reviews.title: The perfect vacation!
